update.description:
This pull request adds preliminary support for contact sensors via a contact system. Each collision entity that has been selected to be a contact sensor will have a `ContactData` component added to it by the contact system. These components get updated by the physics system at each time step. Currently, only the position of the contacts is made available. Normals and wrenches will be added in the future.

**Requires:**

* ~~[ign-msgs #90](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/90/)~~
* [ign-physics #67](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/67)

Note: I have modified pipelines to build ign-msgs and ign-physics from source until they get merged
update.title: [Acropolis] Add contact sensor

content.raw: The build is failing on pipelines after I reverted. Looking at the commit logs for ign-msgs, I don't think there has been a release since [pull request #90](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/90)
content.html: The build is failing on pipelines after I reverted. Looking at the commit logs for ign-msgs, I don't think there has been a release since pull request #90

content.raw: Yes, I did not expect his behavior for non-required elements. Thanks for creating the issue.
content.html: Yes, I did not expect his behavior for non-required elements. Thanks for creating the issue.

content.raw: Ticketed an issue in SDF: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/213/element-get-ignores-default-input-for
content.html: Ticketed an issue in SDF: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/213/element-get-ignores-default-input-for

So I did a quick test on SDF, and it seems that HasElement is doing the right thing, but Get isn't doing what I would expect, see the following test:

diff -r 301cecc99c22 src/Root_TEST.cc
--- a/src/Root_TEST.cc  Thu Jan 31 20:37:41 2019 +0000
+++ b/src/Root_TEST.cc  Tue Feb 26 18:10:10 2019 -0800
@@ -23,6 +23,7 @@
 #include "sdf/Light.hh"
 #include "sdf/Model.hh"
 #include "sdf/Root.hh"
+#include "sdf/Sensor.hh"

 /////////////////////////////////////////////////
 TEST(DOMRoot, Construction)
@@ -63,6 +64,13 @@
     "           </box>"
     "         </geometry>"
     "       </collision>"
+    "       <sensor name='sensor_contact' type='contact'>"
+    "         <contact>"
+    "           <collision>box_col</collision>"
+    "         </contact>"
+    "         <always_on>1</always_on>"
+    "         <update_rate>100</update_rate>"
+    "       </sensor>"
     "     </link>"
     "   </model>"
     "   <light type='directional' name='sun'>"
@@ -95,6 +103,16 @@
   EXPECT_NE(nullptr, collision->Element());
   EXPECT_EQ("box_col", collision->Name());

+  const sdf::Sensor *sensor = link->SensorByIndex(0);
+  ASSERT_NE(nullptr, sensor);
+  EXPECT_EQ("sensor_contact", sensor->Name());
+  ASSERT_NE(nullptr, sensor->Element());
+  EXPECT_TRUE(sensor->Element()->HasElement("always_on"));
+  EXPECT_FALSE(sensor->Element()->HasElement("topic"));
+  auto [topic, success] = sensor->Element()->Get<std::string>("topic", "default_value");
+  EXPECT_EQ("default_value", topic);
+  EXPECT_FALSE(success);
+
   EXPECT_TRUE(root.LightNameExists("sun"));
   EXPECT_EQ(1u, root.LightCount());
   const sdf::Light *light = root.LightByIndex(0);

Fails for Get, but not for HasElement:

[ RUN      ] DOMRoot.StringParse
/home/developer/sdformat/src/Root_TEST.cc:113: Failure
Expected equality of these values:
  "default_value"
  topic
    Which is: "__default__"
/home/developer/sdformat/src/Root_TEST.cc:114: Failure
Value of: success
  Actual: true
Expected: false
[  FAILED  ] DOMRoot.StringParse (44 ms)

content.raw: Strange, I think SDF shouldn't be filling non-required elements, otherwise `HasElement` and the `Get` with a default value wouldn't be useful.
content.html: Strange, I think SDF shouldn't be filling non-required elements, otherwise HasElement and the Get with a default value wouldn't be useful.

content.raw: Changed in 4bd69e9. The problem is the `topic` element has a value of `__default_topic__` when the tag is missing in the SDF.  So I did ` auto tmpTopic = contactElem->Get<std::string>("topic", "__default_topic__").first;`
content.html: Changed in 4bd69e9. The problem is the topic element has a value of __default_topic__ when the tag is missing in the SDF. So I did auto tmpTopic = contactElem->Get<std::string>("topic", "__default_topic__").first;

content.raw: Done. 502844c
content.html: Done. 502844c

content.raw: LGTM, I just left some minor comments and we need to wait for the ign-physics PR to be merged and released.
content.html: LGTM, I just left some minor comments and we need to wait for the ign-physics PR to be merged and released.

content.raw: `LinearVelocity` is not needed
content.html: LinearVelocity is not needed

content.raw: Some of these components are not needed here
content.html: Some of these components are not needed here

content.raw: I feel like we've been using `ignmsg` to notify about new topics available
content.html: I feel like we've been using ignmsg to notify about new topics available

content.raw:
I wouldn't recommend relying on this being the default return string, I think we should either check `HasElement...` or use the `Get` which accepts a default value, something like:

~~~
 auto tmpTopic = contactElem->Get<std::string>("topic", _topic).first;
~~~
content.html:
I wouldn't recommend relying on this being the default return string, I think we should either check HasElement... or use the Get which accepts a default value, something like:

 auto tmpTopic = contactElem->Get<std::string>("topic", _topic).first;

content.raw:
I did a quick search and I think `ign-physics` isn't currently parsing SDF's `restitution_coefficient`, though `ignition::physics::Shape` seems to support it. I'm mentioning this because a bouncing ball usually makes a nice simple demo for contact sensors, in the future we could add this:

~~~
          <surface>
            <bounce>
              <restitution_coefficient>1.0</restitution_coefficient>
              <threshold>0</threshold>
            </bounce>
          </surface>
~~~
content.html:
I did a quick search and I think ign-physics isn't currently parsing SDF's restitution_coefficient, though ignition::physics::Shape seems to support it. I'm mentioning this because a bouncing ball usually makes a nice simple demo for contact sensors, in the future we could add this:

          <surface>
            <bounce>
              <restitution_coefficient>1.0</restitution_coefficient>
              <threshold>0</threshold>
            </bounce>
          </surface>

content.raw: I think this has been released, we can revert
content.html: I think this has been released, we can revert

content.raw: Ah, this is much cleaner! 05162aa
content.html: Ah, this is much cleaner! 05162aa

content.raw: Yup, removed in 05162aa. Thought I would need it at some point.
content.html: Yup, removed in 05162aa. Thought I would need it at some point.

content.raw: Good call. I changed both `Contact` and `ContactData` components to `ContactSensor` and `ContactSensorData` respectively. 05162aa. I'm not too happy with the system being called just `Contact` either, but I didn't want to call it `ContactSensor` because there's a class with that name inside the system.
content.html: Good call. I changed both Contact and ContactData components to ContactSensor and ContactSensorData respectively. 05162aa. I'm not too happy with the system being called just Contact either, but I didn't want to call it ContactSensor because there's a class with that name inside the system.

content.raw: You could also do something like `this->worldEntity = _ecm.EntityByComponents(components::World())`
content.html: You could also do something like this->worldEntity = _ecm.EntityByComponents(components::World())

content.raw: +1, the physics system is technically a "world plugin", at least right now
content.html: +1, the physics system is technically a "world plugin", at least right now

content.raw: I don't see `worldEntity` being used anywhere. Can the variable, and even `Configure`, be removed?
content.html: I don't see worldEntity being used anywhere. Can the variable, and even Configure, be removed?

content.raw: Consider calling this component `ContactSensor`. Unlike other sensors such as `Camera` and `Altimeter`, "contact" is not clearly a sensor.
content.html: Consider calling this component ContactSensor. Unlike other sensors such as Camera and Altimeter, "contact" is not clearly a sensor.
